Mirror Vulnerability.name: Mirror Vulnerability
Mirror Vulnerability.description: Lukarazyll, like all abrikandilu, despises the sight of his own reflection. When a creature Interacts with a mirror within sight of Lukarazyll, he takes a –2 penalty to Will saves against fear effects. If he ends his turn adjacent to a mirror, or the first time in a round he's attacked by a creature holding a mirror, Lukarazyll takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage.

Loathsome Bite.name: Loathsome Bite
Loathsome Bite.description:
When Lukarazyll hits a creature with his jaws Strike, the creature becomes infected with the demon's self-loathing. The creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:34] save to avoid gaining a –1 status penalty to Charisma-based checks. This penalty is cumulative up to –3, and remains even if the wounds are healed. The penalty is reduced by 1 every 24 hours until it reaches 0.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LgZx5xotO08JzhVc]{Effect: Mutilating Bite}

Wreck.name: Wreck
Wreck.description: Lukarazyll makes two claw Strikes against an unattended object, wrenching and gouging it while infesting it with tendrils of fungus. If both Strikes hit, combine their damage for the purpose of overcoming its Hardness. These Strikes don't count toward Lukarazyll's multiple attack penalty, nor does that penalty apply to these strikes. If the object is destroyed, Lukarazyll can use it as hurled debris—the remnants automatically become fungus-infested as part of this act and can create a spore burst on a successful hit.

Lukarazyll.name: Lukarazyll
Lukarazyll.publicNotes:
Wrecker demons, also known as abrikandilus, despise beautiful things and do everything in their power to destroy both people and objects regarded as such. An abrikandilu forms from the souls mortals who were vandals, misanthropes, or defacers of artwork, particularly if their destructive actions stemmed from feelings of powerful envy.

An abrikandilu loathes only one thing more than beauty: their own visage. The mere sight of their face-reflected in a mirror, a shield, or even a pool of water- can send a wrecker demon into a rage. Many demon slayers leverage tactic to their advantage, venturing into battle with polished steel shields and cold iron blades at the ready.

Mortal souls that have been twisted and corrupted by sin sometimes arise in the afterlife as demons. These powerful and destructive fiends seek to spread their particular sin to warp more souls, thereby bolstering their numbers and continuing the cycle.

Miasma.description:
20 foot, @Check[fortitude|dc:37]{DC equal to the siabrae's spell DC - 4}.

A creature that enters the aura or begins its turn there becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a failure (or sickened 4 on a critical failure). An animal, fey, or plant that rolls a failure gets a critical failure instead. Regardless of the result of the saving throw, the creature is temporarily immune to the siabrae's miasma for 1 minute.
Miasma.name: Miasma

Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
Rejuvenation.description: When a siabrae is destroyed, they can attempt a @Check[flat|dc:10] (they automatically succeed if they're standing on blighted or diseased terrain, and automatically fail if they're standing on sacred ground). If the flat check succeeds, the siabrae's body crumbles to dust and absorbs into the earth. After [[/gmr 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}, the siabrae's body reforms from a mass of unworked stone large enough to create a new body; this stone is in a random location within 1d10 miles of where the siabrae was destroyed. The siabrae emerges from the stone with a peal of thunder, though without any of their gear.

Blight Mastery.name: Blight Mastery
Blight Mastery.description: Any of the siabrae's spells or effects that would normally be restricted to affecting animals can also affect undead animals. Furthermore, any animals the siabrae takes the form of or summons appear to be diseased, malnourished, or even dead and rotting. (This doesn't affect their statistics.)

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: The siabrae can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through any earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, the siabrae moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt the siabrae's spellcasting action, the siabrae attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the action isn't disrupted.

Stony Shards.name: Stony Shards
Stony Shards.description: Tiny shards break off the siabrae's antlers when they attack, lodging in the target's wounds and inflicting a terrible curse. A creature damaged by a siabrae's stone antlers Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} on a failure. If the creature critically fails, or fails while already clumsy 2 or greater, the creature is petrified.

Spore Stomach.name: Spore Stomach
Spore Stomach.disable: @Check[nature|dc:37] (master) three times to carefully prune away the fungal roots that connect to the garden below, or @Check[religion|dc:37] (master) three times to exorcise the demonic energies from the fungus
Spore Stomach.hazarddescription: A puffball-like fungus periodically vents gray spores into the air.
Spore Stomach.reset: The spore stomach deactivates if it starts a turn and there are no non-fungus creatures in area E1. It then immediately resets.
Spore Stomach.routine: (1 action; divine, poison) On the first round, the spore stomach sprays a 40-foot-long cone of spores into the left half of area E1. On the second round, it sprays spores into the right half of area E1. On the third round, it takes no action. It repeats this pattern thereafter every 3 rounds. A creature in the area of spores takes @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic|traits:divine,poison] save).
Spore Stomach.stealthdetails: (master) to detect that the spore stomach is hazardous; noticing the spore stomach has a DC of 0

Defensive Spray.name: Defensive Spray
Defensive Spray.description:
Trigger The spore stomach takes damage, an attempt to disable it fails, or combat breaks out in area E1

Effect The spore stomach clenches, exuding gray spores in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20]. Non-fungus creatures in this area take @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save). The spore stomach then rolls initiative.

Fungal Curtain.name: Fungal Curtain

Whistling Decay.name: Whistling Decay
Whistling Decay.description:
Trigger The fungal curtain takes damage or an attempt to disable it critically fails

Effect Pod like protrusions along the fungal curtain clench and then expel a shrill whistling sound along with clouds of flesh-eating spores. The whistling sound alerts the occupants of area E6. Any non-fungus, non-demon creature within 30 feet of the fungal curtain is exposed to the flesh-eating spores and takes @Damage[8d6[poison],4d6[persistent,void]]{8d6 poison damage and 4d6 persistent void} damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic] save). The fungal curtain then rolls initiative.

Fungal Curtain.disable: @Check[nature|dc:42] (master) six times to identify and prune away the fungal curtain's six sensory bulbs (this doesn't remove the curtain; it must still be hacked through to allow access to the area beyond), or @Check[religion|dc:48] (legendary) twice to exorcise the fiendish energies that empower the fungal curtain and cause it to wilt into sludge
Fungal Curtain.hazarddescription: A glowing wall of moss, lichens, mold, and stringy mushrooms weaves into a towering violet wall of shuddersome matter.
Fungal Curtain.routine: (3 actions) The fungal curtain takes the following actions each round in this order; the fungal curtain can perceive targets via darkvision and has a Perception modifier of +38. On its first action, it extends a thorny tentacle to attempt a melee Strike on the closest target in reach—if there's no target in reach, the fungal curtain loses this action. On its second action, it fires a volley of thorny spores into area E5, attempting a ranged thorny spore Strike against all potential targets in the chamber. On its third action, it emits another whistling decay effect.
Fungal Curtain.reset: The fungal curtain deactivates at the end of any round where there were no foes in area E5, then resets at the start of the next round. It restores 10 Hit Points to each damaged section every hour.
Fungal Curtain.stealthdetails: (legendary) to realize the fungus is hazardous; noticing the fungus itself has a DC of 0

Exorcism Vulnerability.name: Exorcism Vulnerability
Exorcism Vulnerability.description:
If an invidiak attempts to possess a creature and the creature rolls a critical success on its saving throw to resist @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession}, or if an invidiak's possession of a creature is ended prematurely, such as via a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, the invidiak takes @Damage[9d6[mental]] damage and cannot use possession for 24 hours.

See Iravalinn's Fight for Control reaction.

Favored Host.name: Favored Host
Favored Host.description:
Vixivax's favored hosts are elves.

Each invidiak has a type of creature they prefer possessing, chosen from aberration, animal, beast, or any humanoid (such as dwarf, elf, or human)—in most cases, the favored type of target is human. When an invidiak casts possession on a favored host, the duration of possession increases to unlimited, and the effect lasts until dispelled or until the invidiak dismisses it.

Shadow Blend.name: Shadow Blend
Shadow Blend.description: The invidiak Strides up to twice their speed. If the invidiak ends their movement in an area of dim light, they become hidden as long as they don't move and the lighting in the area they're in doesn't grow brighter than dim light.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Share Pain.name: Share Pain
Share Pain.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet of the invidiak deals damage to the invidiak

Effect An echo of the invidiak's pain lashes out at the triggering creature, dealing an amount of nonlethal mental damage equal to half the damage the invidiak took from the triggering attack (@Check[will|dc:33|basic] save). On a critical failure, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Unbodied Possession.name: Unbodied Possession
Unbodied Possession.description: Vixivax leaves no body behind when using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wU6hNzK8Yfqdmc8m]{Possession}.

Vixivax.name: Vixivax
Vixivax.publicNotes:
An invidiak has no physical body and is born out of a deep sense of envy over this lack. An invidiak only feels properly "alive" when they're possessing a host. In many cases, an invidiak remains dormant in such a host, spending months, even years, observing from within and building up its influence over the host slowly, so as to cause as much long-lasting despair and emotional trauma to the host's friends and family as possible.

Lengthy Possessions

An invidiak can possess a favored host for an unlimited amount of time, and over the course of years their influence can result in their host gaining strange new and unique supernatural powers that grow from this spiritual corruption. Such powers only function as long as the possession lasts; if the invidiak is forced out of the body, these powers vanish and don't return, even if the invidiak later re-possesses the same host. These unique invidiaks are generally much more powerful than the typical one presented here.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description:
60 feet. Vamollaroth exudes an almost physical reek. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:41] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it's sickened on a critical failure). While within the aura, affected creatures take a –2 circumstance penalty to saves against poison and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.xhkVNfgFMUhalqib]{Effect: Vamollaroth Stench}

Song of the Swamp.name: Song of the Swamp
Song of the Swamp.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect The mobogo unleashes a booming croak. All boggards and mobogos within @Template[emanation|distance:50]{50 feet} gain a +2 status bonus to damage rolls and saves against fear for 1 round. Other creatures in the area of effect must attempt a @Check[will|dc:44] save.

Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Slowed]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for [[/gmr 1d4 #Duration Slowed]]{1d4 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.hftFxE8JGJGzXAtU]{Effect: Song of the Swamp}

Swamp Stride.name: Swamp Stride
Swamp Stride.description: Vamollaroth ignores difficult terrain caused by swamp terrain features.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Regeneration 30 (Deactivated by Acid, Co.name: Regeneration 30 (Deactivated by Acid, Cold, or Fire)

Purity Vulnerability.name: Purity Vulnerability
Purity Vulnerability.description: Vamollaroth revels in the foulness he exudes and becomes distraught when contaminations are purified. The first time in a round when a contamination is purified (such as via @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qXTB7Ec9yYh5JPPV]{Cleanse Cuisine}) or a toxin is counteracted (such as via @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SUKaxVZW2TlM8lu0]{Cleanse Affliction}) with 30 feet of him, Vamollaroth takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage.

Spew Pollution.name: Spew Pollution
Spew Pollution.description:
Vamollaroth spews a foul slurry of pollution and toxic sludge in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60]. Creatures in the area take @Damage[20d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage and must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:44|options:area-effect,damaging-effect,inflicts:stupefied] save. Vamollaroth can't Spew Pollution again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spew Pollution]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is exposed to a level 18 variant of brain worm.

Critical Failure As failure but double damage.

Brain Worm

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:44|traits:disease,virulent|overrideTraits:true]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 day)

Stage 2 stupefied 2, and whenever you take damage, you must succeed at a Will save against the disease's DC or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 round (1 day)

Stage 3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3}, and whenever you take damage, you must succeed at a Will save against the disease's DC or become confused for 1 minute (1 day)

Stage 4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4} and confused, damage does not end the confused condition (1 day)

Stage 5 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} (1 day)

Stage 6 death

Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
Tongue Grab.description:
A creature hit by the mobogo's tongue becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the mobogo. The creature isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the mobogo's tongue.

A creature can sever the tongue with a Strike against AC 43 that deals at least 30 slashing damage. This deals no damage to the mobogo but prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes 1 round.

The mobogo can move without ending the Grab as long as the creature remains within the tongue's reach.

Tongue Reposition.name: Tongue Reposition
Tongue Reposition.description:
The mobogo attempts to move a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by its tongue. The mobogo rolls an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

On a success, the mobogo moves the creature into any space within the tongue's reach. If it wishes, the mobogo can transfer the grabbed creature to its jaws.

Vamollaroth.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值
Vamollaroth.hp: regeneration 30 (deactivated by acid, cold, or fire)
Vamollaroth.name: Vamollaroth
Vamollaroth.publicNotes: Mobogos are massive, swamp-dwelling monstrosities that combine the worst aspects of giant toads and evil dragons. Lazy, cruel, and greedy, these vile creatures make their lairs in the most ancient and primordial swamps. The boggards who call such places home worship mobogos as living demigods, regularly bringing sacrifices of food and valuables lest they become the next victims of the mobogos' boundless appetites.

Souleater.name: Souleater
Souleater.description:
If the vilderavn kills a humanoid with a critical hit using their jaws Strike, they rip out and devour the target's heart and soul as part of the attack.

While the target is dead, the vilderavn can Change Shape into the target's form, gaining a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to impersonate the target.

If magic would resurrect the creature, the caster must succeed at a DC 34 counteract check to extract the target's soul from the vilderavn; otherwise, the spell fails.

Aura of Disquietude.name: Aura of Disquietude
Aura of Disquietude.description:
30 feet. @Check[will|dc:35]

As @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.etMnv73EIdEZrYYu]{Frightful Presence}, plus a creature frightened by the aura becomes suspicious; it doesn't count any other creature as its ally and can't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} or flank. On a critical failure, the creature also can't be a willing target for harmless or helpful magic.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.3oF2DVXCmJ7VloBb]{Effect: Aura of Disquietude}

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.FrightfulPresence]

Bloodbird.description:
A creature hit by a vilderavn's melee attack becomes cursed. It takes @Damage[2d6[bleed]]{2d6 persistent bleed damage} that's difficult to stanch.

The DC to stop the bleeding using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} is 35, and healing the creature to full HP doesn't automatically end the bleeding.

Removing the curse ends the bleeding.
Bloodbird.name: Bloodbird

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The vilderavn takes on the appearance of a Small or Medium humanoid, wolf, dire wolf, or hybrid with both raven and wolf parts. The vilderavn can only use their jaws attack when in a form with a wolf's head, and their talon attack in a form with raven qualities. They can instead assume their raven knight form: a Medium humanoid in black full plate carrying a greatsword. They can use their jaws or talon Strikes only in a form that has that body part, and their greatsword only in knight form.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Feed the Forge.name: Feed the Forge
Feed the Forge.description:
Requirements The Forger's last action was a successful Strike with their trident against a Medium or smaller creature

Effect The Forger attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition} the creature, which remains impaled on the trident. The creature takes @Damage[(3d8+16)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save) regardless of the result of the Reposition attempt. If the creature is Repositioned into a space occupied by a fungal forge, that fungal forge is triggered and uses its Defile and Pollute reaction.

Forger of Tanglebriar.name: Forger of Tanglebriar
Forger of Tanglebriar.publicNotes: In their true form, a vilderavn is a great raven with a wingspan of 6–8 feet. Adaptable shapeshifters, they can change to the fighting forms of a snarling wolf, a hybrid of both wolf and raven, and a tall humanoid in black armor with a massive greatsword. More sinister is their ability to assume a humanoid guise suited to insinuating themselves into the retinues of boastful mortal rulers. With historical knowledge and clever rumormongering, they goad the proud into squabbles, feuds, and ultimately wars. The vilderavn stays at the ruler's side until victory is within grasp, the war almost won, then exacts the cruel stroke of betrayal. Their magic turns the mortals against each other, and the vilderavn's sword falls swiftly.

Spore Queen Quilindra.publicNotes:
数百年前，一群强大的魅魔刺客入侵了疾病和真菌的恶魔领主切斯-乌苏格（Cyth-V'sug）的深渊领域。这些魅魔刺客试图杀死一名强大的女巫，因为她玷污了刺客们侍奉的亵渎神庙。这些魅魔的任务失败了，但从她们的尸体上长出了第一批真菌暴君。女巫对这一发展很满意，于是在物质位面的许多世界播种了真菌暴君的孢子，这些孢子在新的环境中生长繁衍，就像腐烂在尸体上滋生一样。如今，数以百计的真菌暴君栖息在物质位面最肮脏的地方。它们尤其喜欢大型洞穴系统和城市废墟，但也能在荒疫精怪（Blighted Fey）统治的腐朽林地或活跃城市的下水道中找到它们，这些下水道会排放大量含有魔力的废水。

与一只通常没有智慧却有条不紊地行动着的植物怪物的遭遇可能是一只真菌暴君操纵的证据，但真菌暴君同样喜欢饲养其他类型的生物作为宠物和仆从，尤其是有吸引力的类人生物。特别受宠的奴仆会被赐予真菌暴君的拥抱，变成真菌奴仆，永远忠于他们毫无生气的统治者。然而，大多数真菌暴君都意识到，最好有一个多样的守卫阵容，他们通常会选择保留一些非真菌爪牙来保护他们的巢穴。

真菌暴君嫉妒心极强。任何试图引诱他们拥有的宠物或治愈被感染者的人，都会招致他们恒久的愤怒。然而，最能激怒真菌暴君的却是魅魔。在这些恶魔身上，真菌暴君看到了他们再也无法获得的昔日的魅力和力量，只有残忍地摧毁这些嘲弄的记忆才能平息真菌暴君的怒火。真菌暴君面对他们怀疑可能是魅魔的人时确实非常可怕，因为在这种战斗中，这些邪恶真菌生物会放弃他们惯用的巧妙的心理诡计，使出浑身解数，试图将冒犯他们的生物撕成碎片。真菌暴君还非常喜欢把魅魔变成受他们控制的真菌生物。

虽然它们的嫉妒心不会致使它们与其他真菌暴君开战，但它们总是小心翼翼地保持自己的领地与附近的任何同类保持距离，而且它们会竭力忍耐来避免"偷猎"其他真菌暴君被魅惑和侵扰的宠物。

一只真菌暴君通常身高6尺，体重150磅。

孢子奴仆

当一种生物成为孢子奴仆时，它从死亡中复活时的数据与生前相同，但会获得真菌特征，以及对死亡效果、疾病、麻痹和中毒的免疫，其阵营也会转换为与创造它们的真菌暴君一致。孢子奴仆被杀死后，它的灵魂最终会被送往骨园（Boneyard）接受审判，但被真菌包覆的肉体残骸往往会催生出新的真菌生物，如菌体人（Myceloid）、紫蕈（Violet Fungus）或盗袭瘤菌（Drakauthix）。这些真菌子嗣不受真菌暴君的控制，但通常会将他们视为盟友，或者更常见的是视为神灵。

Create Spawn.name: 创造子嗣 Create Spawn
Create Spawn.description:
孢子女王能从敌人身上创造后代，但她不会在战斗中使用这一能力，因为她宁愿看到PC们死去，也不愿给予他们这份真菌的礼物。

如果一个生物因为一个真菌暴君的噬智之吻降至0 HP后死亡，真菌暴君可以将自己的一些真菌物质转移给受害者，让他们在一块真菌中"成熟"24小时，从而将受害者变成孢子奴仆。24小时后，该生物将重获新生，但会获得真菌特征并成为孢子奴仆。这将阻止生物的灵魂进入来世，其方式与不死生物被带出轮回的方式类似--因此，那些将轮回奉为神圣的人（尤其是法莱斯玛（Pharasma）的信徒）认为孢子奴仆与不死生物一样糟糕，尽管它们是活着的生物。如果这个新孢子奴仆的等级低于它的创造者，那么它就会受到创造者的控制。如果真菌暴君同时控制了太多的孢子奴仆（由GM决定），意志坚强的孢子奴仆可以通过@Check[will|dc:28]检定来解放自己。通常情况下，真菌暴君会避免从那些强大到无法控制的倒下的敌人中制造孢子奴仆，因为他们非常清楚这些受害者可能会对剥夺了他们来世的人怀有复仇的冲动。

Grow Sporepod.name: 培育孢子囊 Grow Sporepod
Grow Sporepod.description: 孢子女王能在她60尺内视线所及的任何一点让一个人类大小的真菌物质荚从地面爆出。一旦被创造，孢子囊持续1分钟，直到她移动超过120尺远离它，或直到它被摧毁（AC 45，硬度20，60HP）。她在[[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 轮}内不能再次培育孢子囊，但除了这一点和孢子囊1分钟的生命周期外，同一时间她能拥有的孢子囊数量没有硬性限制。

Mind-Draining Kiss.name: 噬智之吻 Mind-Draining Kiss
Mind-Draining Kiss.description:
频率 每轮一次

效果 孢子女王与她擒获的生物进行激情之吻，试图汲取其意志。这个吻使生物陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，或将其呆滞状态值增加1，最高可达4。生物受到 @Damage[4d6[poison]] 伤害，然后必须成功通过 @Check[will|dc:42] 豁免，否则会被暗示术影响，选择保持静止而不是尝试 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]。

Sporewarp.name: 孢子扭曲 Sporewarp
Sporewarp.description: 孢子女王尝试进行触手打击，但将她120尺内视线所及的一个她选择的孢子囊或灵魂荚视为该触手打击的起点。

Fungaltongue.name: 菌舌 Fungaltongue
Fungaltongue.description: 孢子女王能与所有形式的真菌交谈。她在对真菌生物进行的所有欺骗、交涉或威吓检定中获得+3的环境加值。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Distracted by Failures.name: 失败分神 Distracted by Failures
Distracted by Failures.description:
奎琳德拉对她之前生命中的失败记忆犹新。PC可以通过进行一个具有听觉、专注、语言和心灵特质的动作，尝试@Check[deception|dc:40], @Check[diplomacy|dc:40], @Check[intimidation|dc:40], or @Check[performance|dc:40] 检定来嘲讽她。

大成功 奎琳德拉显著分心；在本遭遇的剩余时间内，她处于 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]状态，陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，并在她的下一回合结束前陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，因为她会花费宝贵的时间对着PC愤怒地咆哮和尖叫。额外的大成功会使她的呆滞状态值增加1，最高可达 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 3}。

成功 与大成功相同，但她不会呆滞，且仅在她的下一回合结束前保持措手不及状态。

失败 奎琳德拉只是略微分心，并在该PC的回合结束前对该PC处于措手不及状态。

大失败 奎琳德拉不受影响。

Sporestride.name: 孢子跨步 Sporestride
Sporestride.description: 孢子女王快步踏入相邻的孢子囊或未被摧毁的灵魂荚（见区域K），并瞬间传送到该区域内的任何其他活跃孢子囊或灵魂荚中，从目标荚中爆出并在此过程中摧毁它。

Vengeful Slice.name: 复仇渴切 Vengeful Slice
Vengeful Slice.description: 孢子女王用她的匕首打击精灵时，会造成额外的 2d6 精魂伤害。被孢子女王的匕首打击降至 0 生命值的精灵会陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1} 因为毁木者注意到了他们的灵魂。

Spore Queen Quilindra.name: 孢子女王奎琳德拉 Spore Queen Quilindra
Spore Queen Quilindra.allSaves: 对抗魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Unrisen Slithermaw.hp: 渴求生机, 虚能治疗

Meant to Live.description: Whenever an unrisen would take damage from vitality energy, it instead heals half that number of Hit Points.
Meant to Live.name: Meant to Live

Reactive Strike (Special).name: Reactive Strike (Special)
Reactive Strike (Special).description:
The unrisen Slithermaw gains 12 extra reactions per round beyond its first, which it can only use to make Reactive Strikes. He can't use more than 1 reaction on the same triggering action, even if a creature leaves several squares on the same triggering action.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ReactiveStrike]

Storm of Jaws.name: Storm of Jaws
Storm of Jaws.description: The unrisen Slithermaw makes up to 12 jaws Strikes, each against a different target. These attacks count toward his multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after he makes all of his attacks.

Resurrection Vulnerability.name: Resurrection Vulnerability
Resurrection Vulnerability.description: A creature with a prepared or spontaneous spell that can restore the dead to life (such as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Hnc7eGi7vyZenAIm]{Breath of Life} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]{Raise Dead}) can expend an appropriate spell slot as a 2-action activity to destroy an unrisen within 30 feet. The attempt fails if the unrisen succeeds at a Will save against the creature's spell DC.

Rise Again.name: Rise Again
Rise Again.description: If the unrisen Slithermaw is reduced to 0 Hit Points by means other than fire damage, disintegration, damage caused by a character wearing Slithermaw's Bane, or his resurrection vulnerability, he returns to unlife at the start of his next turn. He has 150 Hit Points and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} in the space in which he was destroyed. He can't be returned to unlife by this ability again for 1 hour.

Slithermaw's Bane.name: Slithermaw's Bane
Slithermaw's Bane.description: If a PC wears @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.9DuwR6Z1P5PuQwS3]{Slithermaw's Bane}, the unrisen Slithermaw focuses his attacks on that PC. A PC who wears Slithermaw's Bane is immune to all poison damage caused by the unrisen Slithermaw. Whenever such a PC scores a critical hit on the unrisen Slithermaw, the undead hydra becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}. The unrisen Slithermaw is not immune to poison inflicted by Slithermaw's Bane when Calistria's Sting is activated and in fact has weakness 15 to this poison damage.

Awful Approach.name: Awful Approach
Awful Approach.description: The unrisen reshapes its grotesque form to move swiftly. It Strides twice. Any living creature that can see the unrisen during this movement must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:37] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure). This is a mental and visual effect. The unrisen can't use Awful Approach again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Awful Approach]]{1d4 rounds}.

Death Grip.name: Death Grip
Death Grip.description:
Requirements The unrisen has a living creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The unrisen attempts to destroy its victim's life force to share the unrisen's fate. The creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:40] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1}. While the curse lasts, the creature regains only half as many HP from vitality healing effects; if it dies, any attempt to raise it from the dead causes it to return as an unrisen. The curse ends automatically if the creature's doomed value is reduced to 0.

Poisonous Breath.name: Poisonous Breath
Poisonous Breath.description: The unrisen Slithermaw breathes out a toxic cloud of foul vapor from its heads in all directions at once. Creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] take @Damage[15d8[poison]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:40|basic|options:area-effect] save). The unrisen Slithermaw can't use Poisonous Breath again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Poisonous Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Unrisen Slithermaw.name: Unrisen Slithermaw
Unrisen Slithermaw.publicNotes:
An unrisen is a mangled conglomeration of splintered bones, decaying organs, and rotting flesh, created when a ritual such as resurrect goes catastrophically wrong. Immense care must be taken, for if the ritual is a critical failure, an unrisen can be the result—as many a ritualist has learned to their horror.

Unrisen are barely intelligent, aware only of the agony constantly inflicted by their flawed creation and their resentment for the living. They tend to attack the casters involved in the botched ritual first before lashing out at everyone else around them. Though an unrisen's twisted form is unrecognizable as the intended target of the resurrection, its wordless howls are often disturbingly similar to the deceased's voice. If an unrisen is destroyed before it can rise again, it's reduced to a handful of metallic blue-green salts referred to as essential salts.

Sporespawn of Treerazer.name: Sporespawn of Treerazer
Sporespawn of Treerazer.allSaves: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值

Site Bound.name: Site Bound
Site Bound.description: The sporespawn of Treerazer cannot leave the Witchbole's sanctum.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Aura of Spores.name: Aura of Spores
Aura of Spores.description: 60 feet. A faint, hazy green cloud surrounds the sporespawn of Treerazer, causing fungi to grow on plants in the area. A living creature in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:42] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} on a critical failure) from the sensation of these spores taking root on their bodies. A creature that's already sickened and fails their save against the aura of spores becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round because of excessive fungal growth on their bodies.

Witchbole's Heart.reset: The Witchbole's Heart deactivates and resets automatically 1 minute after no targets remain.
Witchbole's Heart.stealthdetails: (legendary) to notice the sphere is hazardous; noticing the sphere itself has a DC of 0
Witchbole's Heart.name: Witchbole's Heart
Witchbole's Heart.disable: @Check[nature|dc:50] to exorcise the corrupted spirit trapped within the Witchbole's Heart, or @Check[thievery|dc:47] three times to deactivate the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} runes scribed in the sphere that allow the corrupted spirit to animate limbs (each one of these successful Thievery checks reduce the hazard's routine by 1 action)
Witchbole's Heart.hazarddescription: A sphere of tangled branches and roots, encrusted with fungus and mold, suddenly animates and reaches out several claw-like limbs.
Witchbole's Heart.routine: (3 actions) The Witchbole's Heart forms several long, thin, spiky limbs tipped with poisonous talons. On each of its actions, it attempts to Strike one non-demon creature in reach of the central sphere. The Witchbole's Heart does can't attempt to Strike a single target more than once per round.

Soulshriek.name: Soulshriek
Soulshriek.description:
Trigger a non-demon creature ends their turn in area D3, or a demon in area D3 issues a command to the Witchbole's Heart to awaken

Effect A distorted arboreal's face forms on the side of the Witchbole's Heart and issues a horrific shriek that sounds as if it were issued through an immense throat made of grinding wood. All non-demon creatures in area D3 or within 30 feet of any entrance to area D3 take @Damage[10d6[spirit]] damage (@Check[will|dc:41|basic] save) as their own souls twist and writhe in pain. The trap then rolls initiative.

Fungal Heart.stealthdetails: (master) to detect that the fungal heart is hazardous; noticing the fungal heart has a DC of 0
Fungal Heart.name: Fungal Heart
Fungal Heart.disable: @Check[nature|dc:33] (master) three times to carefully prune away specific tethers that keep the fungal heart active, or @Check[religion|dc:33] (master) three times to exorcise the demonic energies from the fungal heart.
Fungal Heart.hazarddescription: A pulsing green cluster of fungus suspended in the middle of the spherical room by thick lengths of fibrous stalks.
Fungal Heart.routine: (1 action; divine, poison) The fungal heart clenches as if beating like a real heart, then exudes a churning cloud of toxic spores that fills areas D1 and D2. All creatures in these areas take @Damage[10d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:34|basic] save; creatures in area D1 gain a +4 circumstance bonus to this save due to the diffusion of the spores as they wash into the larger area).
Fungal Heart.reset: The fungal heart deactivates and resets if 3 rounds pass during which no attempts to disable or damage it take place. On subsequent activations of "Treerazer Notices," no telepathic message is sent—it's simply an overwhelming sensation of imminent doom.

Treerazer Notices.name: Treerazer Notices
Treerazer Notices.description:
Trigger The fungal heart takes damage, or an attempt to disable it fails

Effect A sinister voice fills the minds of all creatures in area D1 or D2, speaking in Chthonian: "And so my whelp has failed, yet you have not found salvation—you have doomed Kyonin to fall. Will you be the first to die, or shall you linger long enough to see all you hold dear become mine?" The PCs immediately recognize this voice as belonging to Treerazer and must attempt a @Check[will|dc:39] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} (or doomed 1, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 4}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for as long as they remain frightened on a critical failure). The Fungal Heart then rolls initiative.

Ziberae.name: Ziberae

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Focused Apotheosis.name: Focused Apotheosis
Focused Apotheosis.description:
Zibrerae attacks a single target with all of their black spore knives. The demon makes a black spore knife Strike with the following additional effects. This counts toward Zibrerae's multiple attack penalty as a number of attacks equal to the number of back spore knives Zibrerae used.

Ziberae can use her apotheosis knife in place of one of her black spore knives. When she does so, she attacks with her apotheosis knife Strike instead of a black spore knife Strike.

Critical Success The target takes an additional 2d6 void damage for each knife beyond the first (typically @Damage[6d6[void]]{6d6 extra damage}) and takes @Damage[4d6[persistent,void]] damage.

Success The target takes an additional 2d6 void damage for each knife beyond the first.

Failure The vrolikai deals the damage their black flame knife Strike normally deals on a hit.

Mindwarping.name: Mindwarping
Mindwarping.description:
The sting of a vrolikai is mind-warping. A creature struck must attempt a @Check[will|dc:44] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature becomes stupefied 1. If it's already stupefied, its stupefied value increases by 1 instead (to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 4}).

Critical Failure As failure, plus the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} for 1 minute.

Death-Stealing Gaze.name: Death-Stealing Gaze
Death-Stealing Gaze.description:
30 feet. When a non-demon ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:38] save. If it fails, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

A creature that dies while it has drain from a vrolikai's gaze rises as a ghoul the next midnight. The GM determines what kind of ghoul.

Black Spore Knives.name: Black Spore Knives
Black Spore Knives.description: Ziberae manifests a sickle-shaped blade of what looks like seething black fungus in four of her hands (or three of them if she's wielding his apotheosis knife in one hand). These weapons function as +2 greater striking daggers that deal an additional 2d6 poison damage. On a critical hit, the additional poison damage inflicted by a black spore knife is persistent poison damage. They fade away into nothingness 1 minute after Ziberae no longer carries them.

Consume Death.name: Consume Death
Consume Death.description:
The vrolikai focuses their deathstealing gaze upon a single target they can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Fortitude save against death-stealing gaze.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is affected by death-stealing gaze and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. If the creature was already drained 1 by the death-stealing gaze before attempting the save, a failed save increases the value of the drained condition by 1, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 4}. The vrolikai gains 10 temporary Hit Points, and the drained creature is temporarily immune until the start of the vrolikai's next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but the creature increases the amount of drain by 2.

Ziberae.publicNotes:
Powerful vrolikais command the untamed armies of demonkind, uniting them behind their one unifying desire for death and destruction. Unlike other demons, the dreaded vrolikai doesn't form directly from a single soul—they instead manifest when a demon devours so many damned souls that their own individual desires are lost in the sinful cacophony. A vrolikai who survives this process gains great power and can claim a region of the Outer Rifts as their own domain.

Vrolikais' enthusiastic embrace of the multitude of sins makes them uniquely suited to lead and unite demons, such that even demon lords often must rely on vrolikais to command their forces. The chaotic and conflicting motivations of demonkind leave little room to find common ground, but the vrolikai can expound upon the beauty of every kind of sin while marching demon armies to battle.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Outer Rifts, it can become a deadly fiend—a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin—be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold—the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Outer Rifts.

Demons are selfish and self-absorbed creatures, and most firmly believe that mortals only play at being more virtuous than fiends. They enjoy tempting mortals into damnation to both indulge their egos and swell their armies. Like many other fiends, one of the great rewards of this manipulation is fulfilling their hunger for souls. In their eyes, the primary use for these souls is to spawn new demons, who can serve as soldiers, slaves, pawns, or even currency for their more powerful masters.

prototypeToken.name: 女王泰兰迪娅·艾达瑟瑞

Enhanced Familiar.name: 强化魔宠 Enhanced Familiar
Enhanced Familiar.description: 泰兰迪娅的魔宠是她心爱的猎鹰尼兰宁。尼兰宁的速度为25尺，飞行速度为40尺，并拥有独行和上等抗力（寒冷与火焰）的魔宠能力。泰兰迪娅拥有共享感官和法术传递的主人能力。

equipment-Musings from Below the Crown.name: 《王冠之下的沉思》 Musings from Below the Crown
equipment-Musings from Below the Crown.description:
泰兰迪娅女王最爱的法术书

  • 9th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pswdik31kuHEvdno], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MJx7DmjsWYzDZ3a4]
  • 8th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wfleiawxsfhpRRwf], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Jvyy6oVIQsD34MHB]
  • 7th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0873MWM0qKDDv81O]
  • 6th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5BbU1V6wGSGbrmRD], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.69L70wKfGDY66Mk9], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.uqlxMQQeSGWEVjki]
  • 5th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.bay4AfSu2iIozNNW], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xxWhyl81w3ckslAU], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Ucf8eynbZMfUucjE], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SwUiVavHKMWG7t5K]
  • 4th @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.NzXpEzcZAjuDTZjK], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.A2JfEKe6BZcTG1S8], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Uqj344bezBq3ESdq], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VlNcjmYyu95vOUe8], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]
  • 3rd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.mwPfoYfVGSMAaUec], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yM3KTTSAIHhyuP14], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.fI20AVwOzJMHXRdo], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KHnhPHL4x1AQHfbC], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WsUwpfmhKrKwoIe3]
  • 2nd @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.J6vNvrUT3b1hx2iA], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.CQb8HtQ1BPeZmu9h], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.mrDi3v933gsmnw25], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vTQvfYu2llKQedmY]
  • 1st @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TTwOKGqmZeKSyNMH], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.KcLVELhCUcKXxiKE], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.yV7Ouzaoe7DHLESI]
  • Cantrips @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.kBhaPuzLUSwS6vVf], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0zU8CPejjQFnhZFI], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLzFcIaSXs7YTIqJ], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.60sgbuMWN0268dB7]

+4 Status to Saves Vs. Mental Effects.name: 对抗心灵效果时豁免检定获得+4状态加值 +4 Status to Saves Vs. Mental Effects

Contingent Mislead.name: 触发假像术 Contingent Mislead
Contingent Mislead.description:
触发 泰兰迪娅生命值降至100以下；

效果 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPXzPl7YbMEIGWfi]在泰兰迪娅身上施展，当她的触发术效果被触发时。

Queen's Presence.name: 女王威势 Queen's Presence
Queen's Presence.description: 范围30尺。泰兰迪娅的皇家威势稳定了她的臣民。灵光范围内奇奥尼的所有盟友在对抗情绪效果时，豁免检定获得+2状态加值。此外，当灵光范围内的盟友降低@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened} 状态值时，他们可以选择额外降低1点。

Battle Form Wizardry Casting.name: 战斗形态法师施法 Battle Form Wizardry Casting
Battle Form Wizardry Casting.description: 当泰兰迪娅处于变形法术的效果下时，她可以正常施法和说话。

Quickened Casting.name: 快速施法 Quickened Casting
Quickened Casting.description:
频率 每天一次；

效果 如果泰兰迪娅的下一个动作是施放一个法师戏法或7环或以下的法术，她可以将施放该法术所需动作数减少1个（最少1个动作）。

Reach Spell.name: 及远法术 Reach Spell
Reach Spell.description: 如果泰兰迪娅的下一个动作是施放一个具有范围的法术，她可以将该范围增加30尺。

Queen Telandia Edasseril.name: 女王泰兰迪娅·艾达瑟瑞 Queen Telandia Edasseril
Queen Telandia Edasseril.allSaves: 对抗心灵效果时豁免检定获得+4状态加值 +4 status to saves vs. mental effects

Limber.description: A grizzer ignores difficult terrain from narrow confines and can move at full Speed when Squeezing.
Limber.name: Limber

Regurgitate.name: Regurgitate
Regurgitate.description: The grizzer regurgitates a creature or unattended item from their stomach into an adjacent unoccupied space.

Cold Iron Indigestion.name: Cold Iron Indigestion
Cold Iron Indigestion.description: If the grizzer swallows a cold iron item or a creature holding or wearing a cold iron item, the grizzer becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} until they regurgitate it.

Extradimensional Stomach.name: Extradimensional Stomach
Extradimensional Stomach.description: The grizzer's stomach is an extradimensional space (that appears to be an immense elongated leathery chamber) capable of holding up to 24 Bulk. Unless the grizzer uses Digest, the space has the same environment as the grizzer's surroundings, and creatures inside don't take damage from being swallowed, nor do they face the threat of suffocation.

Digest.name: Digest
Digest.description: The grizzer fills their stomach with acid for 1 round to digest its contents. Creatures inside the stomach must hold their breath or start suffocating, and they take @Damage[4d8[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). The grizzer can Sustain this activity, in which case the stomach remains filled with acid; creatures inside take acid damage at the end of their turn and can't catch their breath. The grizzer regains 10 Hit Points if at least one creature takes acid damage as a result of Digest.

Snatch Object.name: Snatch Object
Snatch Object.description: The grizzer unfurls their sticky tongue at a creature within 15 feet and attempts to either pull the target closer or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} it. If they choose to pull the target, they attempt an Athletics check against the target's Fortitude DC and pull it into an adjacent space on a success. If the grizzer attempts to Disarm the target, they gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the Athletics check if the item is made of shiny material or magically illuminated, such as by revealing light. If the Disarm attempt critically succeeds, the grizzer also grabs the item with their tongue and swallows it.

Grizzer.name: Grizzer
Grizzer.publicNotes:
These gangly fey lizards are known for two traits. First, they look ridiculous when they run, dashing on hind legs while waving their front legs wildly in the air. Second, they're inveterate thieves with the ability to store an extraordinary amount of goods in their stomach. Many grizzers appeared in the River Kingdoms a little over 10 years ago, but several coordinated hunts drove them further southwest, where they've begun to thrive in the forests of Razmiran.

Strange Fey Appetites

A grizzer's strange appetite isn't unique among fey. Azarpals, for example, can store food in their bellies and infuse them with poisons that wreak havoc on feasts and banquets. Stories of whales swimming in otherworldly seas that have swallowed entire villages, or of duplicitous serpentine fey who can assume the forms of those they consume, suggest that fey with strange appetites aren't so unusual on the First World.

Extract Bones.name: Extract Bones
Extract Bones.description:
Requirements A Small or larger dead body is in the klacktel's space

Effect The klacktel destroys the corpse and adds its bones to its body, gaining 50 temporary HP for 1 hour and becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round. It can use the extra action to Stride.

Hungry Bones.name: Hungry Bones
Hungry Bones.description: Each enemy in the klacktel's space takes @Damage[4d8[bludgeoning]] damage and @Damage[4d8[void]] damage with a @Check[reflex|dc:42|basic] save.

Consume Vitality.name: Consume Vitality
Consume Vitality.description:
触发 克拉克特尔将受到命能伤害；

效果 克拉克特尔吸收该命能伤害，并免受该效果造成的伤害。在其下一回合结束前，它失去虚能治疗能力。

Consumption Aura.name: Consumption Aura
Consumption Aura.description:
30 feet. The klacktel's void-infused mass draws living creatures toward it, as iron filings to a lodestone. Living creatures that begin their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:39] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is pulled 5 feet toward the klacktel.

Failure The target is pulled 5 feet toward the klacktel and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the end of their turn.

Critical Failure The target is pulled 10 feet toward the klacktel, is off-guard until the end of their turn, and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Void Beam.name: Void Beam
Void Beam.description: The klacktel fires a beam of void energy in a @Template[type:line|distance:120]. All creatures in the area take @Damage[16d8[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:42|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Klacktel.name: Klacktel
Klacktel.publicNotes:
In places where the dead are discarded in such great volumes that the remains begin to feel more like terrain than bodies, in realms where void energy flows strong and seeks any fragment of once-life to infuse, in areas so suffused with negative emotions and agony like the Amaranthine Oubliette, it comes as no surprise that the cast-off remnants of prisoners over the eons have become monsters.

Over the eons, past wardens of the Oubliette have allowed some of these deadly swarms to escape into other planes for their own inscrutable reasons. Once stranded elsewhere in the Great Beyond, the pain of being cut off from the Void drives the klacktel into a relentless rampage that stops only when it is destroyed.

Cursed Treasure

As a klacktel rolls over anything that comes within its path, rubble and discarded items inevitably become swept up into its mass, adding to the tangle of bones. When a klacktel is slain, the bones quickly rot away into foul-smelling tar, but those items still remaining in its mass that haven't been ground to powder clatter to the ground. Magical items that have lingered overlong within a klacktel can become corrupted and cursed.

Restoration Vulnerability.name: Restoration Vulnerability
Restoration Vulnerability.description: The first time each round that a creature avoids death via an effect like breath of life or spends all their Hero Points to avoid death (but not if a dead creature is restored to life), or the first time each round a broken object is repaired to full Hit Points (such as via a mending or remake spell) within 120 feet of the imvath, the demon takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage.

Doom Soul.name: Doom Soul
Doom Soul.description: An imvath's fangs rip and tear souls as easily as they do flesh and bone. The first time in a round that a creature takes any spirit damage from an imvath's bite, it must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:41] save or its doomed condition value increases by 1.

Lasting Form.name: Lasting Form
Lasting Form.description: When an imvath casts humanoid form, the spell's duration lasts until their next daily preparations.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: 对魔法的豁免+1状态加值 +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Imvath.name: Imvath
Imvath.publicNotes:
Some demons embody subtle methods in their pursuit of tempting mortals to fall into sin so that their souls will be damned to the Outer Rifts. Others embrace brutality and devastation and seek instead to ruin mortal lives and accomplishments. The imvath is both, for their whispers encourage mortals to seek not only their own destruction, but also the destruction of their worlds, so the imvath can enjoy the spectacle of extinction. Thankfully rare, imvaths arise from the souls of mortals whose acts came close to, or actually ended, worlds.

An imvath appears as an androgynous, towering, pale humanoid with four red eyes, an oversized mouth filled with fangs, and dozens of blood-red spurs. One arm is muscular, while the other is gaunt. Its legs end in burning hooves, while a lion's tail and bat wings complete its frame.

Imvath Goals

Whether as generals among demonic armies or as assassins and saboteurs of nations, imvaths know that a world's destruction requires time and dedication. When not actively enjoying planetary devastation, they lend their talents at ruination to those whose work can set a world on just such a path to doom.

Otherworldly Will.name: Otherworldly Will
Otherworldly Will.description: The rotting cultist is driven forward by a singular, otherworldly will, guiding their actions. Whenever the rotting cultist attempts a Will saving throw against a mental effect that would control or dictate its actions, the rotting cultist treats the result of the saving throw as one category better.

Fungal Fervor.name: Fungal Fervor
Fungal Fervor.description:
Trigger The rotting cultist is reduced to 0 HP

Effect The rotting cultist avoids death and reduces their HP to 1. They are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}, and each time they use this ability, their slowed value increases by 1, up to a maximum of 3. Each time they use this ability, a bloom of fungus erupts from their flesh as their movements become even more disjointed. This slowed condition is reduced by 1 each day. Note that since this is a reaction, any further damage done to a rotting cultist that reduces them to 0 HP before they regain their reactions kills them.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The rotting cultist deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted yet are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the rotting cultist.

Pray to the Rotting God.name: Pray to the Rotting God
Pray to the Rotting God.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The rotting cultist calls out to the Rotting God, offering up their flesh in exchange for power. The rotting cultist is healed @Damage[(4d6+8)[healing]] HP, gains a +1 status bonus on attack rolls for 1 minute, and they reduce any condition (other than slowed) affecting them by 1 (if they have a numerical value; this has no effect on conditions without values). The rotting cultist becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 10 minutes as a fungal bloom erupts from their flesh.

Vansidieth.name: Vansidieth
Vansidieth.publicNotes:
Vansidieths rise from the souls of politicians or generals whose pride resulted in great social suffering and tragedy.

Demonic Generals

While some consider demons to be bickering monsters known more for infighting than uniting in a single army, the story of the Worldwound teaches an important lesson. A powerful demon can organize demonic hordes into an incredibly destructive war machine, and vansidieths often lead those armies as generals, coaxing cooperation from the fiendish rabble.

Failure Vulnerability.name: Failure Vulnerability
Failure Vulnerability.description: If the vansidieth uses a damaging spell or makes a Strike on their turn but doesn't deal any damage that turn, they take @Damage[(4d6+6)[mental]] damage at the end of their turn and their imperious gaze aura deactivates until the end of their next turn.

Imperious Gaze.name: Imperious Gaze
Imperious Gaze.description: 30 feet. A non-demon creature that ends their turn in the aura must attempt a @Check[will|dc:37] save. If it fails, the demon's dismissive glance incurs overwhelming feelings of inferiority, causing the creature to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round as it doubts itself and hesitates.

Battle Roar.name: Battle Roar
Battle Roar.description:
Frequency once per minute

Effect The vansidieth attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} all foes within 30 feet (rolling one attempt against all enemies' Will DCs). If the vansidieth critically succeeds against at least one enemy, the demon becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} for 1 round on their next turn and can use the extra action each round to Demoralize or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint}.

Leader of the Pack.name: Leader of the Pack
Leader of the Pack.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The vansidieth orders allied creatures within 15 feet that are level 17 or lower to Step, Stride, or Strike; affected creatures can take the commanded action immediately as a free action.

Gruntch.name: 牢骚精 Gruntch
Gruntch.publicNotes:
尽管大多数古魔专注于将凡人从存在中抹去，岩蟹魔则遵循一个不同的计划，他们将凡人困在无法理解自己行为的形态中，从而无法执行任何值得被放逐到外环裂隙的罪行。对于某些人来说，这可能看起来像是一种仁慈，但对于岩蟹魔来说，这是一种极其必要的行为，他们认为杀死有罪的凡人等同于帮助他们的敌人。

很久以前，在外环裂缝中诞生的恶魔成为其主导力量之前，古魔统治着外环宇宙的无数裂隙。这些敌意的生物是一种原始而外星的邪恶形态，比凡人更加古老，甚至比大部分不朽者都要古老。自从凡人的罪孽兴起以及与之相关的恶魔通过外部裂缝扩张，古魔被驱逐到了最深处，并为失去领地而怀恨在心。然而，古魔并没有直接对抗恶魔，而是将目光转向了源头——凡人的罪孽，并发动了一场无休止的战争，以消灭所有有罪行能力的生物，从而扭转恶魔的洪潮。为了确保他们不增加敌人的人数，他们对目标进行可怕的变形，将受害者转化为无法分辨是非的存在；这使他们无法被法拉斯玛的法庭审判，也因此无法成为恶魔。大多数凡人认为古魔的折磨比他们在来世面临的任何命运都要糟糕得多。

Disquieting Display.name: 不安展示 Disquieting Display
Disquieting Display.description:
岩蟹魔张开口，展示其中藏匿的形态，让观察者质疑自己的身体。@Template[emanation|distance:30]范围内的生物必须尝试进行@Check[will|dc:40]豁免，之后它们对不安展示临时免疫1分钟。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 1}，持续1轮。

失败 生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}且@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，持续1轮

大失败 同失败，但持续1分钟

Gongorinan Venom.name: 岩蟹魔毒液 Gongorinan Venom
Gongorinan Venom.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:40]

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，并且身体有变为动物、真菌或植物的迹象（1轮）

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 2}（1轮）

阶段3 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 4}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{笨拙 Clumsy 4}（1轮）

阶段4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]，身体彻底发生变化（1轮）

阶段5 受害者永久性地在心智和身体上变成动物、真菌或植物，成为永久的诅咒，并且苦难结束。

Painful Limbs.name: 痛苦肢体 Painful Limbs
Painful Limbs.description: 岩蟹魔可以对不同目标进行最多四次打击，每次使用不同的肢体。所有四次攻击都计入其多重攻击减值，但该减值直到岩蟹魔完成所有打击后才会增加。

Withermold.name: Withermold
Withermold.disable: @Check[religion|dc:33] (master) twice to exorcise the unholy presence within the withermold, or @Check[survival|dc:35] (master) twice to safely remove the sensory tendrils growing in the mold
Withermold.hazarddescription: Coils of pale yellow thorny fungal vines on which grow hundreds of brown puffballs suddenly whip into frenzied life.
Withermold.routine: (3 actions) A withermold makes three Strikes with its thorny vines on its turn, splitting its Strikes up among potential targets before striking a single target more than once.
Withermold.reset: A withermold deactivates at the end of any round when there are no targets within reach to attack with thorny vine Strikes. It resets immediately unless it's used all its Spore Burst reactions for the day, in which case the withermold resets in 24 hours.
Withermold.stealthdetails: (master) (or +30 and expert if a PC critically succeeded at Recalling Knowledge about the campsite's condition)

Spore Burst.name: 孢子爆发 Spore Burst
Spore Burst.description:
Frequency three times per day

Trigger A Small or larger creature touches or attempts to enter one of the three tents

Effect The thorny vines of the three withermolds growing on the tents suddenly whip into a frenzy, filling the air with clouds of toxic spores. All creatures within a tent or within 10 feet of a tent's exterior take @Damage[8d6[poison]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:32|basic] save). The withermolds then roll initiative.

Tanglebriar Dependent.name: Tanglebriar Dependent
Tanglebriar Dependent.description: A briargeist is bonded to Tanglebriar and must remain within it. If the briargeist moves outside of Tanglebriar, they are immediately destroyed.

Bewildering Toxin.description:
Saving Throw @Check[will|dc:36]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} (1 round)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} and off-guard (1 round)

Stage 3 @Damage[3d10[mental]] damage, confused, and off-guard (1 round)
Bewildering Toxin.name: Bewildering Toxin

Briarvine.name: Briarvine
Briarvine.description:
The incorporeal seeds ejected from a briargeist grow rapidly when they damage living creatures. Living creatures hit by a briargeist's infesting seed must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:36] save with the following effects. A living creature can only host one briarvine at a time; a creature that currently has a briarvine growing out of them after failing a previous saving throw does not need to attempt additional Fortitude saves.

Critical Success The seed fails to take root.

Success The seed fails to take root, but the target still takes @Damage[2d10[void]] damage as the seed dies out.

Failure The seed takes root within the target and inflicts @Damage[2d10[void]] damage. At the start of the creature's next turn, a long ghostly thorny vine grows out of their body. This ghostly growth makes a vine Strike (as if the briargeist were making the attack) against a randomly determined ally of the host creature within reach at the start of the host creature's turn. If there's no viable target, the vine inflicts @Damage[2d10[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:36|basic] save) on the host. The host can attempt a new Fortitude save at the end of each of its turns; otherwise, this effect ends automatically after 1 minute.

Critical Failure As failure, except the host can't attempt new Fortitude saves to end the Briarvine early.

Briargeist.name: Briargeist
Briargeist.publicNotes:
Briargeists are verdorites unique to Tanglebriar. Millennia spent steeping in Treerazer's corruptive influence has granted them far greater strength while distorting their forms away from the vaguely humanoid to an animate tangle of thorny vines, roots, and fungal growths.

About Verdorites

Verdorites are the enraged spectral echoes left behind when an ecosystem experiences a catastrophic collapse. Calling upon the essences of millions of extinguished plants and animals, they punish any they deem responsible for the disaster, as well as whoever might try to harm the lands to which they are bound. Additional verdorites are detailed on pages 164–165 of Pathfinder Book of the Dead.

Ectoplasmic Lash.name: Ectoplasmic Lash
Ectoplasmic Lash.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The bhuta lashes out with one of the strands of ectoplasm that keep it linked to Deathstalk Tower, inflicting @Damage[13d6[spirit]] damage to all living creatures of the bhuta's choice within 15 feet (@Check[will|dc:32|basic] save).

Primal Corruption.name: Primal Corruption
Primal Corruption.description: A bhuta corrupts wildlife near their bound area, worming their way into animals' minds. Animals who live within the bound area take a -4 circumstance penalty to saves against the bhuta's Possess Animal ability, the bhuta's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} innate spell, and the bhuta's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.aIHY2DArKFweIrpf]{Command} innate spell.

Bound.name: Bound
Bound.description:
Bound to the interior of Deathstalk Tower.

Bhutas are bound to a natural area or feature where they died and must remain within @Template[emanation|distance:120]{120 feet} of that anchor. A bhuta can only leave if invited to travel with living companions, an invitation bhutas often seek to obtain via trickery. While traveling, the bhuta must remain within 120 feet of at least one of the living creatures who invited them. If all members of the group die, the bhuta must return to their bound area by midnight the same day or be destroyed.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The bhuta takes the form of a Large, Medium, or Small bat, insect, or arachnid.. This doesn't change the bhuta's Speed or attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal. No matter what form the bhuta takes, their feet remain backward and they cast no shadow. A bhuta in animal form is still incorporeal, though that isn't obvious just by looking at it.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Spore Spray.name: Spore Spray
Spore Spray.description: The Tanglebriar regent sprays a blast of spores from their body, dealing @Damage[14d6[poison]|options:area-damage] damage in a @Template[type:cone|distance:50] (@Check[fortitude|dc:33|basic|options:area-effect] save). They can't use spore spray again for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Spore Spray]]{1d4 rounds}.

Sunder Objects.name: Sunder Objects
Sunder Objects.description: When an arboreal regent damages an item or structure, it deals an additional [[/r {2d10}]]{2d10 damage} to that item or structure.

Tanglebriar Regent.name: Tanglebriar Regent
Tanglebriar Regent.publicNotes:
Arboreal regents are lumbering, solitary creatures responsible for guarding an entire forest. They take an especially long view of affairs and never act brashly or without much deliberation. They occasionally come together in small groups called groves to share news and pass their wisdom down to the arboreal wardens that have sprouted under their watch. In times of grave danger, all the groves in a region may gather for a great months-long meeting to plan and, eventually, act upon a threat.

The typical arboreal regent is 30 feet tall, has a trunk 2 feet in diameter, and weighs 4,500 pounds.

Arboreals are guardians of the forest and representatives of the trees. As long-lived as the woods they watch over, arboreals consider themselves parents and shepherds of trees rather than their gardeners. Consequently, while arboreals tend to be slow and methodical, they are terrifyingly swift when forced to fight in defense of the woods. Though they rarely seek out the companionship of short-lived folk—even elves are fugacious in the eyes of arboreals—and have an inherent distrust of change, arboreals have been known to tolerate those who seek to learn from their long-winded, rambling monologues, especially if such pupils also express a desire to protect the timberlands. Against those who threaten their realm, such as loggers eager to harvest lumber or settlers aiming to establish croplands or a town, arboreals' wrath is unwavering and devastating. Perhaps ironically, arboreals are gifted at tearing down what others build—a trait that serves vengeful members of their kind well.

Grasping Tail.name: Grasping Tail
Grasping Tail.description: A khravgodon can drag a Large or smaller creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its tail along with it when it Strides.

Crush Chitin.name: Crush Chitin
Crush Chitin.description:
Requirements The khravgodon has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}

Effect The khravgodon bites the creature, dealing @Damage[(2d12+9)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:28|basic] save) that ignores the first 5 of the target's Hardness or resistance to physical damage. On a failed save, the target also takes a -2 circumstance penalty to AC for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7OJrBAEah6YFLzcK]{Effect: Crush Chitin}

+2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Disease.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Disease

Tangle Khravgodon.name: Tangle Khravgodon
Tangle Khravgodon.publicNotes:
Few creatures can shrug off an ankhrav's acid and crunch its chitin like a khravgodon.

Few creatures have survived as long and in as many environments as the opossum.
Tangle Khravgodon.allSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. disease

Desperation Vulnerability.name: 绝望易伤 Desperation Vulnerability
Desperation Vulnerability.description: 罪孽霉怪深知自身作为无定形“新生魔族”的脆弱状态，孤注一掷地在成为更强恶魔的猎物前变强。若罪孽霉怪在战斗遭遇中结束回合且未对其他生物造成伤害，则承受@Damage[3d6[mental]]伤害，并陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

Digestion.name: 消化 Digestion
Digestion.description: 罪孽霉怪在一轮中首次以包卷对生物造成伤害时，立即恢复与伤害值相等的生命值，超出最大生命值的部分转化为临时生命值，持续1小时。只要罪孽霉怪拥有这些临时生命值，其体表硬化，AC提升至30。

Engulf.name: 包卷 Engulf
Engulf.description:
@Check[reflex|dc:32], @Damage[3d10[acid]] 伤害外加消化, [[/act escape dc=32]], 破裂 18

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Engulf]

Sinmold Infestation.name: 罪孽霉怪侵染 Sinmold Infestation
Sinmold Infestation.description:
豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:32]

最大持续时间 6轮

阶段1 @Damage[2d8[poison]] 伤害（1轮）

阶段2 @Damage[3d8[poison]] 伤害，且可凭借模糊感官察觉30尺内根腐者的想法（1轮）

阶段3 与阶段2相同，但 @Damage[4d8[poison]] 伤害，且陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}（1轮）

阶段4 与阶段3相同，且死亡后将转变为根腐者（1轮）

Spore Purge.name: 孢子喷发 Spore Purge
Spore Purge.description:
需求 罪孽霉怪拥有因消化获得的临时生命值

效果 罪孽霉怪失去所有临时生命值，并释放当前包卷的所有生物，将其推入最近的未占据空间。其体内喷发出一团孢子云，对 @Template[type:emanation|distance:20] 范围内的生物造成 @Damage[5d8[poison]|options:area-damage] 毒素伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] 豁免）。豁免失败的生物还需尝试对抗罪孽霉怪侵染的豁免检定。

Riftweasel.name: 裂隙鼬 Riftweasel

Tenacious Grip.name: 顽强抓握 Tenacious Grip
Tenacious Grip.description:
触发 有生物从裂隙鼬的擒抱中逃脱

效果 裂隙鼬扭动身体以维持抓握，并在目标真正逃脱前尝试再次@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]。此次尝试需承受-5的环境减值。

Burst from the Dead.name: 尸骸爆体 Burst from the Dead
Burst from the Dead.description:
需求 裂隙鼬位于尸骸内部

效果 裂隙鼬从尸体的一次血腥爆炸中现身，出现在尸体旁的任意空间。它一边冲出一边尖叫，并溅射出周围的腐肉；裂隙鼬尝试对观察到的生物@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]。在此次尝试中，裂隙鼬即使不发出声音也不会受到任何减值。若它大成功，目标还会因这一令人不安的场景中被溅射到的血肉和腐物碎片而陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

Snap Neck.name: 扭断脖颈 Snap Neck
Snap Neck.description:
裂隙鼬猛扭被它@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei] 或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]的中型或更小生物的头部；该生物必须尝试一次 @Check[fortitude|dc:41]豁免。

大成功 该生物不受影响。

成功 该生物受到 @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning]] 点钝击伤害。

失败 该生物受到 @Damage[4d10[bludgeoning]] 点钝击伤害，并陷入 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF] 1分钟。

大失败 该生物受到 @Damage[8d10[bludgeoning]] 点钝击伤害，并陷入永久 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]。

Lithe.name: 柔韧身躯 Lithe
Lithe.description: 裂隙鼬能像超小型生物一样挤过狭窄空间。在挤入时，它仍能保持全速。

Carrion Eater.name: 食腐者 Carrion Eater
Carrion Eater.description: 裂隙鼬从相邻的死亡生物身上啃食血肉，并恢复@Damage[10d6[healing]]生命值。它只能从每具尸体上恢复一次生命值。

Hide in Carcass.name: 尸骸藏身 Hide in Carcass
Hide in Carcass.description: 裂隙鼬掘入相邻的大型或更大生物的尸体中，然后@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]。只要它留在尸体内部，就能通过震颤感知来感知周围区域，并获得高等掩蔽。裂隙鼬在藏身于尸体中时无需屏息。

Riftweasel.publicNotes:
裂隙鼬的吻部生长着细长且纤薄的触须，这些触须如同胡须一般，能够感知周围的动静；这些触须赋予了裂隙鼬准确的震颤感知能力，使它们即便藏身于大型尸骸内部，也能精准定位到美味的幼虫及其他食腐动物。

施虐成性的食腐者

作为食腐动物，裂隙鼬相当聪明，不过它同样热衷于折磨其他生物。它会毫不犹豫地将猎物摆弄成令人不适的姿态，尤其享受以麻痹状态的生物为食，啃食那些不会迅速致命的身体部位。一旦猎物死去，裂隙鼬还会施放死者交谈来嘲弄和审问自己的美餐，直至享用完毕。那些被裂隙鼬施放魅影杀机的生物，通常会看到自己死后被这只残忍的生物啃食和嘲弄的景象。

Accept Tithe.name: Accept Tithe
Accept Tithe.description:
Trigger A creature drops or offers at least 750 gp in valuables within 15 feet of the tithekeeper

Effect The tithekeeper quickly uses its feet to scoop the valuables into its vault and is now indifferent toward the triggering creature unless that creature uses hostile actions against it or its allies.

Rip Off.name: Rip Off
Rip Off.description:
Requirements The tithekeeper has Impaled a creature

Effect The tithekeeper tears the creature loose from its spiky feet, releasing it. The creature takes @Damage[4d10[slashing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic] save) and is no longer @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}. On a failed save, the creature also takes @Damage[2d8[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Eyes Behind the Mask.name: Eyes Behind the Mask
Eyes Behind the Mask.description: A creature wearing the mask and garb of a priest of Razmir that outranks the tithekeeper's mask and ribbon rank can spend an hour Interacting with the tithekeeper's mask to connect with it. The creature's mask becomes an invested item that allows them to see and hear as though peering through the tithekeeper's mask. The creature must use a 3-action activity envisioning the tithekeeper to activate the scrying effect, and the effect can be Dismissed. Multiple creatures can create connections to the tithekeeper's mask simultaneously, and a creature can have connections to multiple tithekeepers with just one mask. Each connection ends after a week but can be renewed at any time.

Capacity for Punishment.name: Capacity for Punishment
Capacity for Punishment.description: The tithekeeper can have up to six creatures impaled and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its feet at once.

Impale.name: Impale
Impale.description:
Requirements The tithekeeper has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} a creature

Effect The tithekeeper stabs the target with a spike for @Damage[(2d8+13)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic] save). It no longer has to spend an action to extend the duration for the target it has grabbed. The target moves with the tithekeeper and takes @Damage[1d8[persistent,bleed]] damage until it [[/act escape dc=29]]{Escapes}.

Locked Vault.name: Locked Vault
Locked Vault.description: The tithekeeper's body is a locked vault containing any tithes given to it. The vault's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick Lock} DC is 29 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} DC is 33.

Tithekeeper.name: Tithekeeper
Tithekeeper.publicNotes:
Razmir's most powerful priests deploy tithekeepers to ensure his followers don't develop sticky fingers. These ziggurat-like constructs have over two dozen legs and a trap-like mouth. At its top, a mask with a colored ribbon attached denotes its symbolic rank in the Church of Razmir.

Instruments of Terror

Though the tithekeeper's primary function is to collect coins, they're capable of great violence. Priests who determine a village is too far behind on payments might have their tithekeeper skewer multiple residents and wave its victims' bodies in the air as it parades through the streets. Those who survive the ordeal are highly motivated to avoid a repeat experience.

Nature's Edge.name: Nature's Edge
Nature's Edge.description: Enemies are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Shalelu when they're in difficult terrain.

Unimpeded Journey.name: Unimpeded Journey
Unimpeded Journey.description: Shalelu ignores the effects of difficult terrain and treats greater difficult terrain as difficult terrain.

Resilient Hunter.name: Resilient Hunter
Resilient Hunter.description: When Shalelu rolls a success on a Fortitude or Reflex save, she gets a critical success instead.

Favored Terrain.name: Favored Terrain
Favored Terrain.description: Shalelu gains a Climb speed of 35 feet when she's in forested terrain.

Hunt Prey.name: Hunt Prey
Hunt Prey.description: Shalelu designates a single creature she can see and hear, or one she's Tracking, as her prey. She gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the prey. The first time she hits her designated prey in a round, she deals an additional 2d8 precision damage. These effects last until she uses Hunt Prey again.

Gorging Passage.routine: (2 动作) 陷阱在自身回合的首个动作是剧烈震颤，使区域 E4全段成为困难地形直至暴食通道下一回合开始，随后对内部生物进行碾磨并同时从墙壁渗出酸液，区域 E4内所有生物承受 @Damage[4d10[bludgeoning]] 点钝击伤害与 @Damage[8d6[acid]] 点酸蚀伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] ）；
Gorging Passage.name: 暴食通道 Gorging Passage
Gorging Passage.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:50] （传奇）三次以刮除地面与墙壁上的 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{隐藏 Hidden}感应器，或 @Check[nature|dc:55] （传奇）召唤女巫树中残留的原能能量使陷阱失效
Gorging Passage.hazarddescription: 通道会向入侵者合拢，其柔软的木质表面裂开孔洞并试图吞噬内部的一切.
Gorging Passage.reset: 若某轮开始时区域E4内无存活目标，陷阱立即停止运作，并于下一轮开始时重置.
Gorging Passage.stealthdetails: （传奇）以辨识墙壁的异常蠕动

Convulsive Gulp.name: 痉挛吞噬 Convulsive Gulp
Convulsive Gulp.description:
触发 非恶魔、非真菌生物进入隧道中段（以虚线标记）

效果 通道剧烈收缩，区域E4内所有生物承受 @Damage[(4d10+26)[bludgeoning]] 点钝击伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:45|basic] ），随后陷阱骰先攻。

Spore Thrall.name: 孢子奴仆 Spore Thrall
Spore Thrall.blurb: 被毁木者腐化的艾库雅教徒

Spore Burst.name: 孢子爆发 Spore Burst
Spore Burst.description: 当孢子奴仆因除寒冷伤害以外的其他类型伤害而生命值降至0点时，其身躯会爆裂，迸发出一团剧毒的绿色孢子。位于该孢子奴仆周围 @Template[type:emanation|distance:15]范围内的所有生物，均会遭受 @Damage[10d6[poison]|options:area-damage] 伤害（@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect] 豁免）。

Hunt Prey.name: 猎杀目标 Hunt Prey
Hunt Prey.description: 孢子奴仆会选定一个其能看见或听见的单一生物作为其猎物。当它们对猎物进行@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]时，在察觉检定上可获得+2的环境加值；同时，在针对其所追踪的猎物进行第二射程增量内的远程攻击时，可无视相应的减值。若孢子奴仆在已有选定猎物的情况下，再次对另一生物使用猎杀目标能力，则先前的生物的选定状态将丢失。选定状态会持续24小时。

Precise Aim.name: 精确瞄准 Precise Aim
Precise Aim.description: 孢子奴仆对已被其选定为猎杀目标的生物发动攻击时，可额外造成2d6点精准伤害。

Razmiri Blade Assassin.name: 拉兹密尔的锋刃刺客 Razmiri Blade Assassin

equipment-Gray Razmir Robes.name: 灰色拉兹密尔长袍 Gray Razmir Robes

Nimble Dodge.name: 灵巧躲避 Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
触发 锋刃刺客被一个看得见的攻击者当作近战或远程攻击的目标

效果 锋刃刺客在对抗触发攻击时，AC获得+2环境加值

Otherworldly Will.name: 异界意志 Otherworldly Will
Otherworldly Will.description: 锋刃刺客被一种独特而超凡的意志所驱使，指引其动作。每当锋刃刺客针对一种试图控制或支配其动作的心灵效果进行意志豁免检定时，其检定结果的成功度提升一级。

Unexplained Demise.name: 不明死亡 Unexplained Demise
Unexplained Demise.description:
触发 刺客被生擒

效果 鲜血从刺客的耳朵和鼻子中涌出，他们当场倒地身亡。目睹这一不明死亡的相邻PC必须通过@Check[will|dc:22]豁免，否则会陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

Poison Weapon.name: 涂毒武器 Poison Weapon
Poison Weapon.description:
需求 锋刃刺客持握一把穿刺或挥砍武器并且空着一只手

效果 锋刃刺客将一种毒素涂抹在武器上

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 锋刃刺客对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}的生物额外造成2d6精准伤害。

Surprise Attack.name: 突然袭击 Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: 在战斗的第一轮，还未行动的生物对锋刃刺客@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard} 。

Enhanced Fireball Rune.name: 强化火球术符文 Enhanced Fireball Rune
Enhanced Fireball Rune.disable: 通过 @Check[thievery|dc:32]（专家）来擦除符文而不触发传感器，或使用 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]（6级；反制DC 27）来反制符文。
Enhanced Fireball Rune.hazarddescription: 一个隐形符文创造了一个半径为20尺的隐形的球形魔法传感器

Fireball.name: 火球术 Fireball
Fireball.description:
触发 一个活着的生物进入传感器区域；

效果 符文以触发生物所在方格为中心引爆一个火球术。这是一个6环 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]法术，造成 @Damage[12d6[fire]] 点火焰伤害（@Check[reflex|dc:29|basic|traits:fire|options:item:spell] 豁免）。

Fight for Control.name: Fight for Control
Fight for Control.description:
Requirements Iravalinn is possessed by Vixivax

Trigger Vixivax starts his turn while Iravalinn's spellbook, Visions and Fancies, is visible

Effect The sight of his spellbook is enough to bolster Iravalinn's spirit, and he forces Vixivax to suffer the effects of Exorcism Vulnerability.

Rift Portal Network.name: Rift Portal Network
Rift Portal Network.disable: @Check[nature|dc:50] once to delicately cut out or destroy the seven points on the mushroom that connect to the rifts, @Check[religion|dc:41] seven times (once per rift) to exorcise the demonic influence, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.XZE4BawIlTf88Yl9]{Planar Seal} (10th rank, counteract DC 39) to counteract the planar link in this room
Rift Portal Network.hazarddescription: A six-foot-tall green mushroom with red spots on its cap is connected to seven rifts in surrounding alcoves by tendrils of vapor.
Rift Portal Network.routine: (7 actions) Each round, each of the seven rifts fires a beam of demonic energy into the room, targeting one creature (regardless of alliance to Tanglebriar) at random. A single creature cannot be targeted by more than one rift beam per round, so if there are fewer than seven potential targets, the rift portal network loses any remaining actions for that round.
Rift Portal Network.reset: The network deactivates and resets if 1 minute passes without any creature moving in area D4 and without any attempt to disable it.
Rift Portal Network.stealthdetails: (legendary) to notice the network is hazardous; noticing the rifts and mushrooms themselves has a DC of 0

Demonic Attention.name: Demonic Attention
Demonic Attention.description:
Trigger the mushroom takes damage, any of the seven rifts are touched, or any attempt to disable the network critically fails

Effect The demonic energies within each of the seven rifts take note, and the cacophonous sound of howling fiends fills the room. All creatures in area D4 must attempt a @Check[will|dc:41] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure). The hazard then rolls initiative.

Fang Fungus Cage.name: Fang Fungus Cage
Fang Fungus Cage.disable: @Check[nature|dc:41] three times to delicately cut the elf free without causing the fungus to react, or @Check[medicine|dc:47] two times to gently manipulate the fungus loose from where it's tendrils have penetrated flesh, or @Check[athletics|dc:50] to swiftly wrench the elf free from the cage before the fungus can react
Fang Fungus Cage.hazarddescription: A mass of hundreds of long thin fang-shaped fungal growths protruding from the wall encase and pierce the flesh of an elven prisoner.
Fang Fungus Cage.stealthdetails: (master) to realize the fungus will harm its prisoner if it is tampered with; noticing the fungus itself has a DC of 0

Rasp Elf.name: Rasp Elf
Rasp Elf.description:
Trigger A fungus cage takes damage, or any magical effect targets a caged elf

Effect The tendrils constricting and growing through an elf swiftly lash, constrict, and burrow deep. An @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} elf is killed by this, while a conscious elf is rendered unconscious.
